intro: Spyridium bifidum var. integrifolium, commonly known as the smooth-leaved spyridium, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow to cream in color. The leaves are simple, alternate, and have a smooth margin, distinguishing it from other varieties of Spyridium. This plant thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and semi-arid regions. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for native pollinators.
